result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo Jose Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law.
*PROBATION REVIEW HEARING January 22, 2015 at 1: 30 in BR. 40

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the court has approved a modification to no violent contact.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes:
01-22-16/ Judge Janet Protasiewicz
Defendant is non-compliant wih the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 3 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time, in the HOC.

Stayed pending review on 9/25/15.
**9/25/2015 stay lifted as to three (3) days. Straight time, forthwith.  Commitment signed/filed.

defendant.name: Rodriguez, Ricardo Jose

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.
Reflects 01-22-16 Court order imposing 3 days of condition time.

Defendant Ricardo Jose Rodriguez in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 3 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed. Further review needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ricardo Jose Rodriguez in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 3 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ricardo Jose Rodriguez in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 7 months with Huber for work only in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 15 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 9/25/15.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ricardo Jose Rodriguez in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Erica B.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ricardo Jose Rodriguez in court with attorney Cindy L. Hangartner.  Defendant Ricardo Jose Rodriguez in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
